metadata.title: CVE-2018-12406 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 63. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 64.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-12406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
